Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the cost of the dining set by emphasizing the high price tag ($31,000) in relation to the average American's income.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or documentation to support the allegation that taxpayers were billed for the dining set.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the purchase of the dining set was inappropriate or wasteful because it occurred during a time when the Trump administration was planning to cut HUD's budget.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by HUD Secretary Ben Carson himself, who stated that he was surprised by the purchase and requested its cancellation.
